description: A widget that plays a video from an URL.

url.description: The URL of the video to play. Setting this property to any non-empty string changes the *[state](#state)* to `open` and the video starts loading. Setting this property to an empty string unloads the current video and the *[state](#state)* returns to `empty`.

controlsVisible.description: If set to `true`, overlays the video with a native UI for controlling playback.

autoPlay.description: If set to `true`, starts playing the video as soon as the state changes from `open` to `ready`.

speed.description: Returns the current playback speed. The value `1` represents the natural speed of the video. When the *[state](#state)* of the widget is not `play` this property always has the value `0`.

position.description: Returns the current playback position in milliseconds. This property does not trigger any change events.

duration.description: Returns the full length of the current video in milliseconds.

state.description: The current state of the widget.

pause.description: Pauses the video. *[state](#state)* changes to `pause` and `speed` to `0`. Has no effect when *[state](#state)* is not `play`.

seek.description: Attempts to change the `position` to the given time index. Success depends on the currently loaded video. Has no effect if the current *[state](#state)* is `empty` or `fail`.

play.description: Starts playing the video, *[state](#state)* changes to `play`. Has no effect if the current state is not either `pause` or `ready`.

parameters.name: speed
parameters.description: Desired playback speed. If the given speed is not supported by the platform or video, the actual playback speed will be `1` - i.e. the natural speed of the video.

play.description: Starts playing the video, *[state](#state)* changes to `play`. Has no effect if the current state is not either `pause` or `ready`.

change:state.description: Fired when the state property changes.

value.description: The new value of the `state` property.
